Hi everyone!
We are entering the Christmas season, and React bloggers are reducing the pace. On my side, I will skip 2 editions.

segments.source_content: [![Vite 4](/emails/issues/128/vite4.png)](https://vitejs.dev/blog/announcing-vite4.html)
**[Vite 4](https://vitejs.dev/blog/announcing-vite4.html)**

Vite is a frontend tool that keeps growing in popularity. This latest version now uses Rollup 3, which greatly simplifies the management of Vite's internal assets. There are now 2 React plugins with different tradeoffs:

translations.fr: Vite, l'outil frontend gagnant en popularitÃ©, utilise dÃ©sormais Rollup 3, simplifiant la gestion des ressources internes. Deux plugins React aux compromis distincts :
translations.en: Vite, outil frontend en pleine croissance, utilise dÃ©sormais Rollup 3, simplifiant la gestion des ressources internes. Deux plugins React aux compromis distincts :

segments.source_content:
- [vite-plugin-react](https://github.com/vitejs/vite-plugin-react): esbuild + Babel
- [vite-plugin-react-swc](https://github.com/vitejs/vite-plugin-react-swc): replace Babel by SWC in dev, which seems to improve cold start and HMR

- [vite-plugin-react-swc](https://github.com/vitejs/vite-plugin-react-swc) : remplace Babel par SWC en dev, amÃ©liorant le dÃ©marrage Ã  froid et le HMR

segments.source_content: [![Codux - Visual IDE for React projects](/emails/issues/128/codux.jpg)](https://dev.to/codux/introducing-codux-15j5)
**[Codux - Visual IDE for React projects](https://dev.to/codux/introducing-codux-15j5)**

Nadav is co-founder of Wix and presents us his new project, a visual IDE for React (and soon other frameworks). It's not about replacing your current IDE, but rather about completing it. Codux allows you to work on a component in isolation, including editing props and styles via a visual interface. The video [Meet Codux](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KG6i6cCz0P0) should help you understand better. It's a bit like Storybook, but with the ability to edit, and a bidirectional synchronization with your code.

translations.fr: Nadav, cofondateur de Wix, nous prÃ©sente son nouveau projet, un IDE visuel pour React (et bientÃ´t d'autres frameworks). Il ne s'agit pas de remplacer votre IDE actuel, mais plutÃ´t de le complÃ©ter. Codux permet de travailler sur un composant de maniÃ¨re isolÃ©e, incluant l'Ã©dition des props et des styles via une interface visuelle. La vidÃ©o [Meet Codux](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KG6i6cCz0P0) vous aidera Ã  mieux comprendre. C'est un peu comme Storybook, mais avec la capacitÃ© d'Ã©diter et une synchronisation bidirectionnelle avec votre code.
translations.en: Nadav, co-fondateur de Wix, nous prÃ©sente son nouveau projet : un IDE visuel pour React (et bientÃ´t d'autres frameworks). Il ne s'agit pas de remplacer votre IDE actuel, mais plutÃ´t de le complÃ©ter. Codux permet de travailler sur un composant de maniÃ¨re isolÃ©e, y compris la modification des props et styles via une interface visuelle. La vidÃ©o [Meet Codux](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KG6i6cCz0P0) vous aidera Ã  mieux comprendre. C'est un peu comme Storybook, mais avec la possibilitÃ© d'Ã©diter et une synchronisation bidirectionnelle avec votre code.

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ“– Beta docs: [team page updated](https://twitter.com/reactjs/status/1601328677677338624) + [useTransition demo](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1600709819648069632) + [useSyncExternalStore API ref](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1600530747550564354)
- ğŸ“– [New Supabase Docs, built with Next.js](https://supabase.com/blog/new-supabase-docs-built-with-nextjs): Supabase's doc is migrating from Docusaurus to Next.js, due to the growing need to build something custom. Nevertheless, they give a very positive feedback on Docusaurus.
- ğŸ“– [React Router website repository public](https://twitter.com/remix_run/status/1600979694622367744)
- ğŸ“– [React-Spring - New doc site](https://twitter.com/_josh_ellis_/status/1602253329526128641)
- ğŸ“œ [Integrate Next.js and Storybook automatically](https://storybook.js.org/blog/integrate-nextjs-and-storybook-automatically/): introduce the automatic support of Next.js via the new [Framework API](https://storybook.js.org/blog/framework-api/) that comes in Storybook 7 (now in [beta](https://github.com/storybookjs/storybook/releases/tag/v7.0.0-beta.0)). Storybook is able to understand your Next.js project better. No more need to add decorators/addons for navigation, Link and Image components. The support will continue to improve over time: Server Components, next/font...
- ğŸ“œ [Optimizing Web Fonts in Next.js 13](https://www.lydiahallie.io/blog/optimizing-webfonts-in-nextjs-13): probably the best illustrated article explaining font layout shifts. Explains at the end how Next.js optimizes this for us automatically. Worth reading!
- ğŸ“œ [Migrating a large, open-source React application to Next.js and Vercel](https://vercel.com/blog/migrating-a-large-open-source-react-application-to-next-js-and-vercel): Vercel is doing a POC of migrating the BBC's open-source site, just for fun ğŸ˜„ They're highlighting the benefits gained just by being on a Next.js stack and call BBC to action if they want to pursue this migration.
- ğŸ“œ [Avoid These Common Pitfalls Of React useState](https://profy.dev/article/react-usestate-pitfalls): 6 common useState anti-patterns presented with solutions + embedded interactive exercice playgrounds
- ğŸ“œ [The Evolution of urql](https://formidable.com/blog/2022/evolution-of-urql/)
- ğŸ“œ [Publishing Docusaurus to dev.to with the dev.to API](https://dev.to/johnnyreilly/publishing-docusaurus-to-devto-with-the-devto-api-9bg)
- ğŸ“œ [An Introduction To RedwoodJS](https://blog.openreplay.com/an-intro-to-redwoodjs/)
- ğŸ“œ [Using Path Matching in React Router](https://www.taniarascia.com/path-matching-in-react-router/)
- ğŸ“œ [Testing API Calls in useEffect using React Testing Library and Jest](https://www.taniarascia.com/how-to-test-useeffect-api-call/)
- ğŸ’¬ [Improve React Query hydration, Streaming SSR & Server Components](https://github.com/TanStack/query/discussions/4623)
- ğŸ¦ [Xuan Huang - "Forget is in good hands as we now have a team behind it"](https://twitter.com/Huxpro/status/1601345567493214208): Xuan also mentions that he left Meta
- ğŸ¨ [React-Three-Editor demo - Threejs Journey scene](https://twitter.com/0xca0a/status/1601315795006410752)
- ğŸ¦ ["I fixed vanilla-extract/sprinkles using a vite plugin"](https://twitter.com/astahmer_dev/status/1601246126396428289): new Vite plugin that could significantly reduce the CSS emitted by Vanilla-Extract / Sprinkles
- ğŸ¦ [Ryan Florence - "Next.js isn't really OSS"](https://twitter.com/ryanflorence/status/1600526114010845184)
- ğŸ“¦ [React-Nylon](https://github.com/CodyJasonBennett/react-nylon) + [Four](https://github.com/CodyJasonBennett/four): something is cooking. Soon, a lightweight [Three.js / React-Three-Fiber alternative](https://twitter.com/0xca0a/status/1602286391777546242)?
- ğŸ“¦ [Remix 1.8](https://github.com/remix-run/remix/releases/tag/remix%401.8.0): the "React-Router-ing" is progressing
- ğŸ“¦ [Chakra UI Figma Kit](https://twitter.com/chakra_ui/status/1602683717830512641)
- ğŸ¥ [Modern Component Library with React & Storybook](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLKBvDYynKmlWa59k8pnw-EHac2_miPagh)
- ğŸ¥ [MaterialUI + Qwikify demo](https://twitter.com/Steve8708/status/1601257653367209984)

ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’¼ [**Product Engineer at Causal, Remote/London/NY, $150-250k**](https://jobs.lever.co/causal-app/4acaafbe-ef3d-45a6-bbe6-687c022d727c?lever-origin=applied&lever-source%5B%5D=thisweekinreact.com)

segments.source_content: Do you want to work on the world's most used apps? Would you like to co-create the React Native technology? Join the Callstack team of React & React Native leaders. Check our website for more details. We are looking forward to seeing your application - show us what you've got!

## ğŸ”€ Other {#other}

- [Optimize Interaction to Next Paint](https://web.dev/optimize-inp/): Google devs explain how to improve the performance of our apps interactions (the new INP metric). This is particularly interesting for our React SPAs.
- [2022 In Review: Whatâ€™s New In Web Performance?](https://www.debugbear.com/blog/2022-in-web-performance):A nice overview of what's new in webperf in 2022. The 2023 predictions indicate work to better measure SPA performance, instead of just the initial page load metrics. TIL about the [soft-navigations](https://github.com/WICG/soft-navigations) repo.
- [Ecma International welcomes new members](https://www.ecma-international.org/news/ecma-international-welcomes-new-members-6/): welcoming Shopify and Vercel
- [Zod 3.20](https://twitter.com/colinhacks/status/1602238724120924160): glad to see the coercion coming, very useful to convert some query-string params (example: ?pageSize=10) into numbers automatically.
- [Vitest 0.27.7](https://github.com/vitest-dev/vitest/releases/tag/v0.25.7): Vite 4 support
- [Tauri Mobile Alpha Release](https://tauri.app/blog/2022/12/09/tauri-mobile-alpha): if I understand correctly it is using a WebView - new competitor to Cordova/Capacitor? ğŸ¤”
- [New npm features for secure publishing and safe consumption](https://github.blog/2022-12-06-new-npm-features-for-secure-publishing-and-safe-consumption/): finally a code explorer on the npm site!
- [WebKit Features in Safari 16.2](https://webkit.org/blog/13591/webkit-features-in-safari-16-2/)
- [Bun 0.3.0](https://bun.sh/blog/bun-v0.3.0)
- [Alma - a digital playground for generative graphics](https://twitter.com/emilwidlund/status/1600815398672211969)
- [TypeScript: Should you use Types or Interfaces?](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zM9UPcIyyhQ)

- [Optimize Interaction to Next Paint](https://web.dev/optimize-inp/): Les dÃ©veloppeurs de Google expliquent comment amÃ©liorer les performances des interactions de nos applications (la nouvelle mÃ©trique INP). C'est particuliÃ¨rement intÃ©ressant pour nos applications React SPA.
